Constructor Detail

MapGUI

public MapGUI()
Creates new form MapGUI. Map is placed to default location on the screen Note that the initial location of the map is (0,0) which is the bottom left cell Note that the initial location of the map is (0,0) which is the bottom left cell

MapGUI

public MapGUI(int x,
              int y)
Creates new MapGUI at the given location of the screen Note that the initial location of the map is (0,0) which is the bottom left cell

Parameters:
x - X coordinate on the screen from top left corner of monitor
y - Y coordinate on the screen from top left corner of monitor
Method Detail

setGoal

public void setGoal(int row,
                    int column)
Changes the goal location to the given row and column. The previous goal location is updated with the new one.

Parameters:
row - Vertical coordinate. The bottom row is 0th, top row is max(row)-1
column - Horizontal coordinate. The leftmost column is 0th, rightmost is max(column)-1

getGoal

public int[] getGoal()
Returns the coordinate of the goal in an array

Returns:
Goal location. The first value is row and second is column of the goal.

addWall

public void addWall(int row,
                    int column)
Adds a wall to the given location. If there is already a wall, it is ignored

Parameters:
row - Vertical coordinate. The bottom row is 0th, top row is max(row)-1
column - Horizontal coordinate. The leftmost column is 0th, rightmost is max(column)-1

getMap

public int[][] getMap()
Returns the whole map as double array. The initial position of the map is bottom left cell. It goes vertically up and right.

Returns:
Map as double integer array. In the map 0 means empty, 1 means there is wall, 2 means there is goal.
Note: You can loop in the map array as follows:

int[][] map = mapGUI.getMap();
for(int i=0; i&lemap.length; i++)
    for(int j=0; j&lemap[i].length; j++)
         ...process... map[i][j]

isWall

public boolean isWall(int row,
                      int column)
Check whether the given location has wall or not

Parameters:
row - Vertical coordinate. The bottom row is 0th, top row is max(row)-1
column - Horizontal coordinate. The leftmost column is 0th, rightmost is max(column)-1
Returns:
True if location has wall, False otherwise

moveRobot

public void moveRobot(int row,
                      int column,
                      int angle)
Moves the robot on the map. You can use it to only rotate or both rotate and change the location of the robot on the map.

Parameters:
row - New vertical coordinate of robot. The bottom row is 0th, top row is max(row)-1
column - New horizontal coordinate of robot. The leftmost column is 0th, rightmost is max(column)-1
angle - New angle in degrees (ie: 30°) of robot

moveRobot

public void moveRobot(int row,
                      int column,
                      java.lang.String direction)
Moves the robot on the map. You can use it to only rotate, move or both rotate and change the location of the robot on the map.

Parameters:
row - Vertical coordinate. The bottom row is 0th, top row is max(row)-1
column - Horizontal coordinate. The leftmost column is 0th, rightmost is max(column)-1
direction - New cardinal direction (E,NE,N,NW,W,SW,S,SE) of robot

getRobotLocation

public int[] getRobotLocation()
Returns the location of the robot as integer array.

Returns:
Robot location in integer array. The first value of array is the row and second is column on the map

getRobotAngle

public int getRobotAngle()
Returns the angle of the robot in degrees (ie: 30°)

Returns:
Angle of the robot on the map as int

getRobotDirection

public java.lang.String getRobotDirection()
Returns the cardinal direction of the robot (E,NE,N,NW,W,SW,S,SE). If the robot is not directly on one of 8 cardinal directions (ie: 15%deg) it's rounded to the closest cardinal direction (ie: E)

Returns:
Cardinal direction of the robot on the map as String

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Container

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main function allows the MapGUI run standalone

Parameters:
args - the command line arguments
